jcr:content.jcr:title: Grammy Award for Best Gospel Vocal Performance by a Duo or Group, Choir or Chorus

contentheadline.headline: Grammy Award for Best Gospel Vocal Performance by a Duo or Group, Choir or Chorus

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=December 2009}} The [[Grammy Award]] for '''Best Gospel Vocal Performance by a Duo or Group, Choir or Chorus''' was awarded from 1984 to 1990. The award was originally titled '''Best Gospel Performance by a Duo or Group'''. This was changed to '''Best Gospel Performance by a Duo or Group, Choir or Chorus''' in 1986 and "Vocal" was added in 1990. Years reflect the year in which the Grammy Awards were presented, for works released in the previous year. ==1990s== *[[Grammy Awards of 1990]] **[[Take 6]] for "The Savior Is Waiting" ==1980s== *[[Grammy Awards of 1984]] **[[Larnelle Harris]] & [[Sandi Patty|Sandi Patti]] for "More Than Wonderful" *[[Grammy Awards of 1985]] **[[Debby Boone]] & [[Phil Driscoll]] for "Keep The Flame Burning" *[[Grammy Awards of 1986]] **[[Deniece Williams]] & Sandi Patti for "They Say" *[[Grammy Awards of 1987]] **Larnelle Harris & Sandi Patti for "I've Just Seen Jesus" *[[Grammy Awards of 1988]] **[[Mylon LeFevre]] and Broken Heart for ''Crack the Sky'' *[[Grammy Awards of 1989]] **[[Winans family|The Winans]] for ''The Winans Live at Carnegie Hall'' {{DEFAULTSORT:Grammy Award For Best Gospel Vocal Performance By A Duo Or Group, Choir Or Chorus}} [[Category:Grammy Awards for gospel music]]
